revised_title: Retina Receptive Fields in Houseflies: Anatomical and Physiological Properties
tldr: The authors investigated the receptive fields of cells in the retina of houseflies (Musca domestica) and found that the interommatidial angle and receptive field size agree well with the optomotor model. The study confirms that the interommatidial angle is smaller in the vertical than the horizontal plane, and the results provide data to test the model further.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Neurobiology and Sensory Systems
